Description: We're carrying out planned work in your area. For our engineers to carry it out safely they need to turn the power off. We're doing this work as it's essential to provide reliable electricity supplies to your area. We're sorry for any inconvenience caused and thank you for your patience.

Our contractors Avidety Ltd are replacing and upgrading some overhead electricity cables with improved insulated cables. This will improve the reliability of our electricity network and reduce the risk of you having an unplanned power cut. This is why it is important to complete this work during the Coronavirus pandemic. You may see our contractors completing preparation works prior to the outage to allow for a shorter interruption. This work is taking place outside Baxters up to 45 Bell Road.
We need to temporarily turn the power off to carry out replacement of poles that support our overhead power lines in the area. Work is scheduled to start

Our contractors Avidety Ltd are replacing and upgrading electricity poles due to them decaying. They will also be replacing and upgrading some overhead electricity cables with improved insulated cables. This will improve the reliability of our electricity network and reduce the risk of you having an unplanned power cut. This is why it is important to complete this work during the Coronavirus pandemic. You may see our contractors erecting the new electricity poles prior to the outage to allow for a shorter interruption. This work is taking place outside 87 The Quarries up to 45 The Quarries. Please note we will need to close the road on the day of the works.

We are carrying out these works to upgrade a piece of equipment known as a pole transformer to enable new services to be connected to the overhead electricity network. This work is following on from a customer's request and to ensure engineers can carry out this work safely will need to temporarily switch off your power. This work will ensure the electricity network can uphold the amount of electricity required for the area. During this time you will be connected to a generator to provide you electricity whilst we carry out our essential works. We aim to connect and disconnect the generator within 15 minutes so your power may come on sooner. This work is taking place in the Woodhill Lane area.

A third party has requested that UK Power Networks switch off the power to allow them to carry out tree trimming safely around our low voltage overhead electricity cables. This work will ensure that the trees are trimmed to their satisfaction and are not close to our overhead electricity cables. When the third party has completed their works our engineers will be able to restore power. This will also reduce the possibility of you having an unplanned power cut by stopping these trees from potentially causing damage to our overhead electricity network. This is why it is important to complete this during the Coronavirus pandemic. This work is taking place on Kithurst Lane.

Our contractors Avidety Ltd are replacing and upgrading electricity poles due to them decaying. They will also be replacing and upgrading some overhead electricity cables with improved insulated cables. This will improve the reliability of our electricity network and reduce the risk of you having an unplanned power cut. This is why it is important to complete this work during the Coronavirus pandemic. You may see our contractors erecting the new poles prior to the outage to the allow for a shorter interruption. Due to safety reasons our contractors need to complete a safety check with your internal equipment checking a plug and a socket on separate circuits to enable the power to be turned on and off. Due to these checks being manual we aim to turn the power off at 09:30 and back on at 15:30, however please allow extra time for the checks to be completed. Access will only be required before and after the planned power cut. This work is taking place outside Messines to outside Marne on Upper Road.

Our engineers are installing new electricity poles and upgrading some overhead electricity cables with improved insulated cables. This work will allow our engineers to upgrade the  electricity service to a property in the area. Once completed this work will improve the reliability of the electricity network and will reduce the risk of you having an unplanned power cut which is why it is important to complete this work during the Coronavirus pandemic. This work is taking place on Ships Lane next to Homefield. The government has given exemptions to certain industries and activities, this outage falls into this category.

You may see our contractors completing preparation works prior to the outage including the delivery of materials to allow for a shorter interruption on the day. This work is taking place in and around Beveridge Bottom.

We're sorry for the loss of supply. The reason you're currently without power is a planned outage in the areas listed. We have turned off your electricity supply to allow us to safely carry out essential work to our electrical equipment. By doing this, it'll help us to improve the reliability of our service to you for the future. If you have any questions or require more information, please call us on 105 or send us a message on Facebook or Twitter (@ssencommunity) with reference '199290'. You will have received a letter from us confirming your power will be interrupted with specific information relating to your property. If you did not receive this letter, you can assume your power will not be interrupted.

Description: There is a power cut in the DG8 postcode area of Newton Stewart. We had no advance warning of this and only became aware of it at 03.03am. Our team has managed to restore power to a number of properties in the area and are arranging for generators to restore supply for the rest of our customers without power. We now expect all power to be back on as quickly and as safely as possible by 08.00am. We will update this message if this information changes. We apologise for the inconvenience and thank you for your patience. This message was updated at 05:55am on Monday, 26 April 2021
